meanings.definition: In a manner that is proportionate or in proportion
meanings.sent1: She divided the candies proportionably among the children.
meanings.sent2: The ingredients were added proportionably to the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The clown juggled the balls proportionably, making sure not to drop any.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was spread proportionably, touching the hearts of many.
meanings.sent5: The colors in the painting blended proportionably, creating a harmonious effect.

meanings.definition: In a way that corresponds in size, amount, or degree to something else
meanings.sent1: The sizes of the boxes were proportionably arranged on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The prices of the items were marked proportionably to their value.
meanings.sent3: The students lined up proportionably according to their heights, creating a funny sight.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed proportionably, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The music notes flowed proportionably, creating a soothing melody.
